description: A Hall Effect water flow sensor that measures the rate of liquid flow through a plastic valve body and flow rotor. It outputs a digital pulse for each revolution of the rotor, allowing calculation of flow rate and volume.

other: Output pulse high level: >4.7 VDC @ 5 V
Output pulse low level: <0.5 VDC @ 5 V

getting_started.connection_guide: Connect the red wire to a 5–12 VDC supply, black wire to ground, and yellow wire to a digital input pin (e.g., A0) on the microcontroller.

example_code.explaination: The sketch counts pulses from the sensor, calculates frequency, converts to flow rate (L/min) using the sensor’s calibration (7.5 pulses per L/min), and accumulates total volume. Results are displayed on an LCD.

source_document: Handson Technology User Guide for YF-S201B Water Flow Sensor (pages 1–6 of the provided text).
